summary: Workflows remain in running state until all async coroutines complete or are manually cancelled, even after the workflow reaches a return/exception condition. This is intended behavior but can be inconvenient when managing long-running activities with async completion.
userImpact: Users may struggle to cleanly terminate workflows with unfinished async coroutines without manually cancelling each scope.
rootCause: Async coroutines intentionally block workflow return until they complete or are cancelled; this is by design rather than a bug.
workaround: Manually call cancel() on async scopes before workflow return to allow graceful termination without waiting for activities to complete.
resolutionDetails: Confirmed as intended behavior. Team advised updating documentation to clarify that cancellation can be triggered from inside workflows and should be used for cleanup.
keyQuote: Async coroutines will block the return from the workflow until they are complete or canceled. It's intended behavior.
